alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 31 at 4:06PM PDT until April 02 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 2000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches with up to 15 inches possible. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast, Central Douglas County, Eastern Curry County, and Josephine County. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels could drop to valley floors Sunday, especially in the Illinois Valley. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; South Central Oregon Coast
